function:
def modify_features(df_input) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """
    Thought 1: Counting the occurrences of each unique value in the Weight column can provide insights into the distribution and frequency of crab weights.
    New Feature 1: weight_counts | weight_counts = df['Weight'].value_counts()
    """
    import pandas as pd
    import numpy as np
    """
    Thought 1: Utilizing the logarithm operator on the Weight column can help scale down the wide range of weight values to facilitate better model training.
    New Feature 1: log_weight | log_weight = df['Weight'].apply(np.log)
    
    Thought 2: Computing the residual between Length and Diameter can provide insights into the proportionality between these two physical attributes of the crab.
    New Feature 2: length_diameter_residual | length_diameter_residual = df['Length'] - df['Diameter']
    
    Thought 3: Calculating the square root of the Height column can reveal a more balanced and normalized representation of the crab's height.
    New Feature 3: sqrt_height | sqrt_height = df['Height'].apply(np.sqrt)
    """
    df_output = df_input.copy()
    
    # Utilizing the logarithm operator on the Weight column
    df_output['log_weight'] = df_input['Weight'].apply(np.log)
    
    # Computing the residual between Length and Diameter
    df_output['length_diameter_residual'] = df_input['Length'] - df_input['Diameter']
    
    # Calculating the square root of the Height column
    df_output['sqrt_height'] = df_input['Height'].apply(np.sqrt)
    
    return df_output
